conclusion: To determine if objects A and B have the same velocity at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the given acceleration-time graph.
The graph shows acceleration (\( a \)) on the y-axis and time (\( t \)) on the x-axis.
Object B has a constant acceleration, represented by the straight line from the origin to point \( B \).
Object A has zero acceleration after time \( t_1 \), as indicated by the horizontal line at point \( A \).

premise: From \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_1 \), object A accelerates at the same rate as object B.
conclusion: After \( t = t_1 \), object A has zero acceleration.

premise: Velocity is the integral of acceleration with respect to time.
conclusion: For object B, the velocity at time \( t_1 \) is \( v_B(t_1) = a_B \cdot t_1 \).

premise: Conclusion: At time \( t_1 \), objects A and B have the same velocity.
conclusion: Final Answer: Yes, at time \( t_1 \), the two objects have the same velocity.
